text:
Chrissy Teigen is on the case!

The pregnant supermodel took to Twitter on Monday to address the story Tiffany Haddish told the April issue of GQ, where she alleges that an actress "bit Beyonce in the face."

"I cannot leave this planet without knowing who bit Beyonce in the face,” she tweeted. “I can only think of one person who would do this. but I cannot say. but she….is the worst."

I can only think of one person who would do this. but I cannot say. but she....is the worst. — chrissy teigen (@chrissyteigen) March 26, 2018

While Teigen, 32, would not name the actress she had in mind, she did respond to a fan that inquired if she thought the person Haddish was referring to was Gwyneth Paltrow.

"No, I love her," she responded.

no I love her! — chrissy teigen (@chrissyteigen) March 26, 2018

When Teigen was asked by another fan to just "spill it," she quipped, "Deep down, you know."

After another commenter pleaded with her to name names, Teigen then admitted that her assumption was not right. "My initial guess was wrong," she wrote. "The real person? I *never* would have guessed. I’VE SAID TOO MUCH."

My initial guess was wrong. The real person? I *never* would have guessed. I’VE SAID TOO MUCH — chrissy teigen (@chrissyteigen) March 26, 2018

Teigen added: "I AM NEVER TELLING I’m scared I’ve said too much KNOWLEDGE IS A CURSE!"

Haddish also did not offer any details as to the actress she claims to have bitten Beyonce, but did speak at length about the alleged incident.

“Beyonce's at the bar, so I said to Beyonce, ‘Did she really bite you?’" Haddish recalls. "She was like, ‘Yeah.’ I was like, ‘She gonna get her a** beat tonight.’ She was like, ‘Tiffany, no. Don't do that. That b***h is on drugs. She not even drunk. The b***h is on drugs. She not like that all the time. Just chill.’”

GQ reached out to Beyonce's rep, Yvette Noel-Schure, who told the magazine, "I absolutely cannot comment on any of this, as I have no knowledge."

Earlier this month at the Oscars, ET spoke to Haddish about Beyonce seemingly calling her out in her song, "Top Off," with DJ Khaled. In the track, the mother of three raps: "If they’re tryna party with the queen, they gon’ have to sign a nondisclosure."

The line is rumored to be in reference to the 38-year-old comedian's story about the night that Beyonce took a selfie with her so she wouldn’t get into a fight.

"I made it!" Haddish joyously proclaimed. "Beyonce put my name in a song. I made it!"
